bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 16, 1899

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, October 16, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Oct 16 99
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I had intended writing
to you yesterday but somehow
the day slipped by without my
doing it. The baby's sweaters are
awfully nice. They are large and
comfortable and he looks well
in them. He continues to cut teeth
the upper ones look as though they
would come through soon.

I was glad to get your letter
on Tuesday. I hope you and Mrs
McCallam will have a nice
time together. Let me know on
what train to expect you.
I have not been out at Windsor
for some time but I saw Alex
a few days ago and learned
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE.
that they were well. Alex is
not yet settled in an office.
He would be wise to leave
Baltimore I think.

Hope to hear from you
soon - Mabel sends love
